market_summary: Data integrity failure: All price snapshots returned 404 errors preventing portfolio valuation and benchmark comparison for February 17 session
Rebalance discipline enforced: Day 5 of 7-day minimum hold period post-February 12 rebalance, next rebalance window opens February 19-20 per weekly cadence

Portfolio construction unchanged: Unable to verify current prices but systematic hold period preserves eight-name allocation (27% Energy, 20% Technology, 18% Commodities, 12% Healthcare, 12% Financials, 11% Industrials) pending data availability

thesis: Systematic rebalance discipline enforced: Day 5 of 7-day minimum hold period post-February 12 rebalance, next rebalance window opens February 19-20 per weekly cadence
Data integrity constraints prevent position-level assessment: All ticker price snapshots returned 404 errors, making valuation and momentum rescoring impossible for February 17 session

Portfolio construction remains optimal based on last verified data: Eight-name allocation designed for 6-18 month structural themes (energy leadership, defensive gold, quality compounders, selective technology) with no change triggers available without current pricing
risks: Data availability risk acute: Complete price snapshot failure prevents real-time monitoring of position-level moves, drawdowns, or thesis-invalidating price action across all eight holdings
Blind hold period exposure: Unable to assess if AVGO tech weakness continued, if GLD profit-taking materialized, or if energy sector rotation intensified during February 17 session

Systematic process compromise: Rebalance-due day (February 19-20) decision quality degraded if data availability issues persist, forcing reliance on stale February 16 pricing for momentum/quality rescoring
falsifiable_checks: If data availability is restored before February 19 rebalance window and any single position shows >8% adverse move from February 16 levels, emergency review warranted despite hold discipline
If February 19 rebalance window opens with continued data unavailability across multiple tickers, defer rebalance execution until data integrity is restored to avoid blind portfolio construction
trade_of_the_day.why_now: Day 5 of 7-day minimum hold period following February 12 full portfolio rebalance. Complete data availability failure (all price snapshots returned 404 errors) prevents position-level assessment but does not override systematic rebalance discipline. Prior seven-day context shows portfolio delivering as designed through February 16: gold providing exceptional hedge performance (+7.9% cumulative through Friday), energy consolidating sector leadership (27% allocation stable), quality compounders resilient (LLY/JPM), technology showing normal single-name volatility (AVGO weakness contained within 10% position size). Without current pricing data, premature action based on stale information would sacrifice process discipline and transaction cost efficiency. Systematic hold period through February 18 remains optimal path, with full rebalance assessment scheduled for February 19-20 window pending data restoration. Portfolio remains allocated to 6-18 month structural themes validated by last available evidence: energy sector leadership, defensive gold allocation, quality growth compounders, selective technology exposure. Next rebalance window (in 2-3 days) allows proper momentum/quality rescoring with complete data integrity across expanded candidate universe.

constraints_check.notes: Position limits: GLD 18% (max 40% OK), all others 10-15% (OK). Sector limits: Energy 27% (XOM+CVX), Technology 20% (KLAC+AVGO), Commodities 18% (GLD), Healthcare 12% (LLY), Financials 12% (JPM), Industrials 11% (XLI) - all <80% sector cap. Crypto: 0% (no crypto holdings, <10% OK). Factor scores: UNKNOWN (data unavailable). Risk budget: UNKNOWN (no pricing data for drawdown/vol assessment). Scenario stress: UNKNOWN (no current prices for shock simulation). Execution plan: No trades executed, hold period day 5/7. Monitoring triggers: Data restoration check February 18 evening; if any position >8% adverse move vs Feb 16 upon data restoration, emergency review; rebalance window opens Feb 19-20 with full candidate rescoring.
